contentrichtext.text: {{for|the American college basketball coach|Brett Reed (basketball)}} {{Infobox musical artist | name = Brett Reed | image = | background = non_vocal_instrumentalist | birth_name = Brett A. Reed | alias = | birth_date = {{Birth date and age|1972|7|12}} |birth_place =[[United States]] | instrument = Drums | genre = [[Punk rock]] | occupation = Musician | years_active = 1991â€“2006 | label = | associated_acts = [[Rancid (band)|Rancid]]<br>[[Devils Brigade]]}} '''Brett A. Reed''' (b. July 12, 1972 in [[Oakland, California|Oakland]], [[California]]) is an [[United States|American]] musician, best known as the original drummer for the [[punk rock]] band [[Rancid (band)|Rancid]] and [[Devils Brigade]].<ref name=AllmusicRancid/><ref name=Rude/><ref name=InMusicWeTrust/><ref name=RSWarped/> He joined Rancid in November 1991 and left 15 years later. He played on every Rancid release up to their 2003 album ''[[Indestructible (Rancid album)|Indestructible]]''. On November 3, 2006, his announcement of leaving Rancid was made public and he was replaced by [[Branden Steineckert]]. He plays lefthanded. ==References== {{Reflist|refs= <ref name=AllmusicRancid>Huey, Steve. [{{Allmusic|class=artist|id=p41116/biography|pure_url=yes}} Rancid biography] at [[Allmusic]]</ref> <ref name=Rude>Tiffen, Margo. [http://www.pinupnyc.com/articles/rancid.html "Rancid"], Rude International, Fall 1998</ref> <ref name=InMusicWeTrust>Steininger, Alex. [http://www.inmusicwetrust.com/articles/11h03.html Brett Reed interview], In Music We Trust</ref> <ref name=RSWarped>Goldman, Marlene. [http://www.rollingstone.com/artists/rancid/articles/story/5922007/warped_and_waiting "Warped and Waiting" (Lars Frederiksen interview)], ''[[Rolling Stone]]'', July 23, 1998</ref> }} {{Rancid}} {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME =Reed, Brett | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH =July 12, 1972 | PLACE OF BIRTH = [[United States]] | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Reed, Brett}} [[Category:1972 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:American punk rock drummers]] [[Category:Rancid (band) members]] {{US-rock-drummer-stub}}
